website_summaries.verdict: It's basic and practical, but it's not the best choice if you prefer a spout w/a gentle-flow sprinkler head.
pros: Though it isn't fancy, the sturdy resin build, 1-gallon capacity, and 1-piece design is practical and resists leaks
cons: The spout is a bit large and awkward when watering small, delicate plants
On the other hand, the filling hole on top of the can is somewhat small and challenging to fill

customer_reviews.title: Unbalanced. Can't carry it with one hand.
customer_reviews.text: My complaint with this watering can is that it is unbalanced and not very ergonomic. When full, if you pick it up with one hand by the handle it will tip forward and water spills out of the spout. You must use both hands to support the watering can level to prevent this, or have a very strong wrist to keep the spout cocked up so that it doesn't spill. If you don't already have carpal tunnel syndrome, this will likely give it to you. Not happy with it, but inexpensive enough that I don't feel the need to return it.
customer_reviews.author: JB-RRS

customer_reviews.title: Great company, Great for outdoor plants
customer_reviews.text: This watering can is great!!! LOVE the color and size. BUT I purchased it to use on my indoor plants, and the spout on this is quite large making it very difficult to not overflow smaller pots. Realizing this would not suit my needs, I sadly requested a return label. The buyer offered a full refund AND said I did NOT have to return the product. What amazing and unexpected customer service!!! I will be buying my smaller spouted watering can from Dynamic Design for sure!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Over-priced dollar store junk.  Leaks like a sieve around the spout, getting water everywhere.
customer_reviews.text: This item is extremely poorly fit and leaks prodigiously around the spout, making control of the water flow very difficult. Ultimately, this is a poorly-made, albeit extremely expensive, piece of dollar store junk. Look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Wrenfroe

customer_reviews.title: Suitable more for indoor plants than outdoor - the 80 ounce size
customer_reviews.text: I'm a little disappointed in the size, I wasn't thinking correctly when I ordered it - this isn't large enough for watering my outdoor container plants, but it's fine for indoor use. I like that this doesn't have the sprinkler on the end because some plants do better if not watered directly on the foliage. You can fill this almost to the brim and it won't spill out when walking. One thing I don't like is the handle kind of gets in the way of the kitchen faucet when filling it up.
customer_reviews.author: Nacho Libra

customer_reviews.title: Made in the USA
customer_reviews.text: I love that this product is made in the USA. Searched long and hard on Amazon to find it to support workers in this country. So tired of everything being made in China and often taking weeks or months to arrive. Support American workers ... buy this one. It’s a solid, quality product! Would buy again!
customer_reviews.author: NursinOne

customer_reviews.title: Very good
customer_reviews.text: Great watering can. I've been using it for months now and have no complaints. no leaking, no rough edges on mine and I like the design very much. Edit: over 1 year later still loving it! Its like new and I use it A LOT.
customer_reviews.author: BreeTop Contributor: Nail Art

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size for a watering can!
customer_reviews.text: Looked at WalMart and all the big box stores around but they all had huge watering cans that were heavy even without the water! This is the perfect size for tending porch plants. Saved my summer to find it and in a non-obtrusive color.
customer_reviews.author: L. Brannel

customer_reviews.title: Awquard, Can't fill it without spilling it, difficult to carry when full
customer_reviews.text: It's not great, you can't fill it up and carry it easily at all because of the handle design. The opening at the top is too small as well
customer_reviews.author: Anne Williams

customer_reviews.title: Well made, one-gallon
customer_reviews.text: Not flimsy plastic, so nice to finally find a decent 1 gallon watering can. Thanks manufacturer!
customer_reviews.author: Abby McIlroy

customer_reviews.title: How is this possible?
customer_reviews.text: This watering can had to have been damaged before sending. It doesn't look like the one pictured. It's very dark green. I bought this to replace my old crappy one & now I have a new crappy one. For $14?! It looks & feels like it's worth about 5.
customer_reviews.author: D. K. Chapman

customer_reviews.title: Overall I am pleased with the purchase - no defects and the small ...
customer_reviews.text: The description includes this watering can's capacity, but was still a bit smaller than I expected. I purchased for work where I have one small, one medium and one large potted plant. A thorough watering for the large plant requires two trips to fill the can. Overall I am pleased with the purchase - no defects and the small size makes for easy storage. Furthermore, the spout design makes splatter-free watering easier.
customer_reviews.author: Clan N

customer_reviews.title: Leaky
customer_reviews.text: The flimsy plastic cover over the spout is leaky and causes water to go everywhere. It was cheap and it holds 2 gallons of water but otherwise, it’s not a good purchase. 2 stars because I’m still able to use it, but just outside because of the poor design.
customer_reviews.author: AndrewATX

customer_reviews.title: Can U dig it
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a simple watering can. I wanted one that was dark colored and easily stored. So many of the cans have width issues. This one is very thin. It looks nice in a simple way. Very pleased
customer_reviews.author: Tuco

customer_reviews.title: Purchased 3 Only got 2. 1 mashed in.
customer_reviews.text: Product as advertised. I ordered 3 and received only 2. 1 of which was mashed in some but I was able to straighten out enough to use. Still looking for the 3rd one. No option on site to contact seller.
customer_reviews.author: Robert E. Hawkins

customer_reviews.title: spend the money to get something else
customer_reviews.text: The design is not balanced. Have to use 2 hands to keep it up right when full. Least from the plastic spout cover. I would guess about 30% of the water flow leaks from the sides rather than just coming out the holes in the spout. I'm not a fan.
customer_reviews.author: Maxk

customer_reviews.title: Great watering container!
customer_reviews.text: I like the green color first off, next is the size. The size is perfect for my watering needs. When it's filled it's easy to lift and maneuver. It's made out of strong, durable plastic. I'm sure it will last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Kobe

customer_reviews.title: Great design, plastic so so
customer_reviews.text: This watering can is the perfect design for 2 quarts. I looked everywhere for the shower head and a hole on top to fill it. I wish the plastic was thicker. It can easily be dented. So not the highest quality plastic but the rain head spout and the overall design makes up for it. Just don't put too much pressure on the outside or it will dent.
customer_reviews.author: Dana

customer_reviews.title: Love The Size
customer_reviews.text: Had this watering can for years (tan color version), but the plastic eventually got brittle and broke. Was hard to find the exact same can so when I finally did find it (only difference being green), I bought 3 of them. Very happy.
customer_reviews.author: Alf33

customer_reviews.title: don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: 2 gal size: can't hold it by handle alone without spilling a lot of water, so lose much of it walking around to plants. The spout LEAKS a LOT, no matter how many ways you turn it. This is USELESS... a total waste of $14.40.
customer_reviews.author: Nic

customer_reviews.title: Item was damaged upon receipt
customer_reviews.text: Hello, this rather expensive watering can (at $27) was damaged upon receipt with multiple dents in the plastic. I would like to keep the item as it is still functional, but feel that discount is should be issued due to the damage. I'll improve the rating upon receipt of a 40% discount.
customer_reviews.author: Cody Vaudrin

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Basic watering can. Works well for watering 6 potted plants on my patio without refilling and without blistering my hands. Easy to fill from the faucet without having to use the water hose. The plastic keeps it from getting hot in the sun if left out unlike the metal cans. Don't step on it though. It is very difficult to pop back into its original shape. :)
customer_reviews.author: ToddlerMom

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply made
customer_reviews.text: This is cheaply made and very thin. I hope it will last a season. The price doesn’t match the quality. Expensive for the poor quality.
customer_reviews.author: Bubbagum

customer_reviews.title: 1 gallon is smaller than expected, but serves its purpose
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this to keep handy because we have a dog that pees on a small patch of grass, killing it. It's handy to not have to pull out the hose each time.
customer_reviews.author: haoplee

customer_reviews.title: very handy
customer_reviews.text: Replacement for one I bought at Lowe's. I liked it so much I bought it again here in Amazon when it was out of stock.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Sepulveda

customer_reviews.title: This broke immediately
customer_reviews.text: This broke after using 1 time. Do yourselves a favor and cancel and delete amazon prime. Most things are now fake or poorly made replicas of real products. This is just one of the many things we’ve bought from amazon this year that was cheap and disappointing. I have officially quit amazon and this was my last purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Just the right size and easy to fill since there is no handle blocking the ...
customer_reviews.text: Just the right size and easy to fill since there is no handle blocking the fill hole. No leaks and the quality is good. Works well for me and I would buy another as a gift for family.
customer_reviews.author: Bella

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Good solid construction, but light enough to lift up for hanging plants.
customer_reviews.author: Carrie Hansen

customer_reviews.title: Not the greatest
customer_reviews.text: The size is nice but the handle design is uncomfortable and not well balanced. If the can is full it is hard to hold onto without spilling water and that is not good for use in the house.
customer_reviews.author: M. Fischer

customer_reviews.title: Serve its purpose well
customer_reviews.text: I like the smaller opening on top. It prevents the water from sloshing as one walks from plant to plant.
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: Quality of can
customer_reviews.text: Wasn't as big as expected.... not add thick a material... cheaper ones at Lowe's

customer_reviews.title: Good well balanced can.
customer_reviews.text: It's a nicely balanced watering can. Otherwise the price was good. What more can you say about a watering can?

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE THIS  Southern Patio 1 Gallon Watering Can, Fern  ONE GALLON IS IDEAL SIZE FOR THIS WATERING CAN.....NOT TOO HEAVY

customer_reviews.title: harrisv
customer_reviews.text: It is hard to fill, does not fit under kitchen faucet. Handle not high enough.

customer_reviews.title: Decent watering can leaks a little.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great sized watering can. It does leak though. We wrapped thin white tape around the ridge of the spout before screwing the white spout back on and that helped. It still leaks just not as much. The size is just what I wanted. I use it almost daily.
customer_reviews.author: Makeitrainpink

customer_reviews.title: What I expected.
customer_reviews.text: White cap on end of spout leeks. Probably the plastic tooling. However would buy again. My last one just like this one lasted for 5 + years.
customer_reviews.author: Paula Gray-C.

customer_reviews.title: Decent watering can- some leaking at the nozzle
customer_reviews.text: Is watering can leaks at the nozzle. It's a pretty basic watering can. Can't say that I'm overly disappointed.

customer_reviews.title: great design
customer_reviews.text: Really like the hole to fill with water is on the top without a handle in the way. Holds enough water to water all my plants, which are many.
customer_reviews.author: Annie

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Fill
customer_reviews.text: Someone used their brain to make this one... it is one of the few watering cans I've found that can be filled from the kitchen faucet without the handle getting in the way! It's the little things in life! :)

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: It holds a gallon and is durable. Just what i was looking for.

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars

customer_reviews.title: The handle is not above the center of gravity of ...
customer_reviews.text: The handle is not above the center of gravity of the full can. In consequence when picked up in the most natural way, the container tips forward, spilling some of the water.
customer_reviews.author: Michael H. Davison

customer_reviews.title: Holds just the perfect amount of water and doesn't leak.
customer_reviews.text: It is PERFECT, holds just the right amount of water without being too heavy!!!!!!!!! and doesn't leak like all my others.
customer_reviews.author: Happy Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Works and Looks Good
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for indoor watering. It's impossible to spill when watering around the house and it is quite attractive when not in use. It might be smaller than the pictures look but it's the perfect size for watering around the house. I'd recommend this for the price.

customer_reviews.title: Outdoor watering can

customer_reviews.title: Great Product.

customer_reviews.title: How did I live without this watering can?

The description says it is an 80 oz watering can, what I received was a MINIATURE watering can that could only be used by a doll. It was too small even to be used by a child. I returned it and got my money back.

customer_reviews.title: Some customers amaze me.
customer_reviews.text: Some customers amaze me...the description clearly states that this watering can holds 28oz. if you have any idea how much liquid there is in a quart of milk (which is 32oz. by the way) then you certainly wouldn't expect this to be any bigger. i found it to be exactly what i was looking for. i have a few plants and have no need to carry around a large watering can. And the design keeps the water from spilling out of the spout while you're walking around with it. Definitely 5 stars in my opinion.
